intro: Elatostema femineocymosum, commonly known as the female cyme elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy surface. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are often overlooked due to their size. The plant is noted for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed soils.
